meanings.definition: The next to last syllable in a word.
meanings.sent1: In the word 'banana,' the penult is 'na.'
meanings.sent2: She struggled to pronounce the penult correctly in the spelling bee.
meanings.sent3: The penult of 'elephant' sounds like a trumpet playing.
meanings.sent4: The penult of the word 'whisper' holds the secret of its softness.
meanings.sent5: Remember, the penult is the syllable right before the last one.

meanings.definition: The second to last item in a series.
meanings.sent1: The penult in the list of ingredients was sugar.
meanings.sent2: He always saves the penult cookie for last.
meanings.sent3: The penult item in the grocery bag was the loaf of bread.
meanings.sent4: The penult chapter of the book revealed the main character's true identity.
meanings.sent5: Don't forget to check the penult item on your to-do list before finishing.

meanings.definition: The second to last day of the month.
meanings.sent1: On the penult of December, they prepare for the New Year's Eve party.
meanings.sent2: She always feels nostalgic on the penult of the month.
meanings.sent3: The penult of the month is a time for reflection and planning.
meanings.sent4: The penult of the month is when she starts counting down to her birthday.
meanings.sent5: The penult of the month is a busy time for everyone.
